1534.context:
Apologies if this is posted in the wrong section. I was hoping I can post about this here because my problem involves a Smart TV; I assume that those belong in the Smart Home category? Perhaps I should have asked this in the Samsung Apps/Services? -shrugs-
Anyways, here is our issue:
When casting a phone's screen (Galaxy) to a Samsung Tizen Smart TV using SmartThings and/or Chromecast causes the Galaxy phone to be unable to send or receive calls. Multi-tasking with anything else on the phone while casting media to the TV seems to be working fine - e.g. texting works & notifications pop-up on the phone even while casting media via youtube, SmartThings (Screen Mirroring) or Google Home.
So what is going on here? I went through most of the settings and did a little light google searching but was unable to fix this issue. I mean, like, shouldn't phone calls work while casting? I was pretty certain that there would be a notification popup on the phone/TV when receiving a call - especially if you can't talk on the phone while casting, but apparently I was wrong?
I could have sworn that my iPhone (brother got it for me don't ask lol it's actually a decent phone ... but that's a whole different story that we just won't get into :D) was able to send and receive phone calls when casting ... or it would at least give me a notification so I know.
Anyways, what am I doing wrong?
Any advice on how to troubleshoot this?
Assume I'm not a complete newbie and have done the more basic things already.
Either way, any help is appreciated for the simple fact that time was taken to read/reply, :).
A few things:
- The phone can send and receive calls when it is not casting.
- The devices in question include both Samsung devices: Samsung's Galaxy & Tizen Smart TV.
 If it turns out that this is something that is well known and phones simply are not able to send/receive calls while casting to another device then ... well... dang.
I just assumed that such a possibility is incredibly unlikely in this day and age ... but I do always say assuming can be dangerous... 😞

1573.title: S21 Ultra Wireless Fast Charging Doesn't Work With USB-C to 3.5mm Headphone Jack Adapter
1573.context: I think I discovered a software bug with the wireless charging feature on the S21 Ultra. I recently bought a Qi wireless charger for my car that supports wireless fast charging (10W). For some reason, whenever I plug in a USB-C to 3.5mm headphone jack adapter (Samsung EE-UC10JUWEGUS) it changes the charging speed to a slower one. As soon as I unplug the jack adapter it goes back to fast charging. I tested my phone out with other Qi chargers that support 10W fast charging with and without the jack adapter and I get the same results. I then tried plugging in a normal USB-C cable (not connected to any power source) and the wireless fast charging worked fine. Therefore, the problem must be with USB-C to 3.5mm jack adapter. I tried using an older Note 8 with the jack adapter and the wireless fast charging worked fine. This is rather annoying because my car does not have Bluetooth and I need that adapter to listen to my music, get directions from google maps, and make calls.

1595.title: S21 Battery
1595.context:
I upgraded from Note 9 to S21, since I rarely used the S-Pen and since I thought it would be nice to have 5G service. After the first 2 days, I almost returned it, since the battery drain seemed to be 2X more that my Note 9. 
The final solution was two fold... (1) went in to settings and turned if background services on EVERY application that was not essential, excluding  Email, LinkedIn, etc. and (2) went in to settings and told every app to close when not in use.
Prior to doing thus the phone ran hot during "normal use" and after the wireless carrier and Samsung support suggested running it for 2 days without 5G. My response to them was "seriously, you want me to turn off the 5G functionality that was the reason I bought the S21.
By limiting  background services and closing applications when not in use,, my battery life is acceptable, but many believe the 5G radio draws more power than 4G, but that is yet to be confirmed.

1600.title: S21 Ultra Serious Delay
1600.context:
I ordered my S21 Ultra 128g titanium on Jan. 27. No where on the site or any notice from within the ordering process was I notified of any type of delay. I first started calling about 10 days after my order as it has been shown under the status from day one as "expedited". I spoke with a rep and they said because I ordered titanium that it would be longer since it was a special order. I was seriously unhappy with that response since NO WHERE on the site or within ordering process did it say that special color schemes (or the like) would take longer to process being a special order.

They couldn't give me a timeline, only that it's *expedited* in the shipping process order status. The add-ons were free but they have a ship date of March 31, but it doesn't say that the phone itself will be shipped on that date. Is the wording to upkeep hope that the phone will come sooner and the rest at the later date or that is the overall actual date of the phone shipment but they don't want to ward off buyers for taking so long? Who knows (I'll admit I wouldn't wait because the point of getting the newest release is that one gets it relatively close to that release date).

Anyway, I tried to cancel three times and after the third time when a rep said it could be done, I received an email saying that due to manufacturing process it has to remain in the system, that I can just reject it when it gets shipped to me (this was said by the first two phone reps). Seriously, that is how one cancels an order, like they're making it appear that it's a carved in stone process. This is yet another way to get the customer to just take the phone upon arrival. So, I ask if I order a black phone how long that would take, they said about 2 weeks. But after reading how some here are waiting a month for just that color scheme, I am totally put off .
 Here's the real kicker; just got an email today (February 19) that my order is now delayed (remember what I said about March 31) and that my phone will ship no later than April 7 (or before). So this kind of confirms that my order wasn't going to ship until March 31 along with the add-ons. Just WOW, two and a half months after ordering this device will I get it. Darn, that will be pushing into the next Samsung releases of phones!
 tl;dr
 Ordered S21 Ultra Titanium on Jan 27, got email saying that it won't be shipped until no later than April 7, that's about 2.5 months! :grimacing_face:
 Edit update: having a online chat abt the delay the rep abruptly ended that chat. Now trying to get back has an even longer wait. This is customer service for you. I am just going to reject the phone when it arrives. Not taking a phone that's near halfway though a release cycle to the next release in August.

1619.title: new S21 purchased from Samsung.com IMEI not recognized as ATT device in carrier unlock database
1619.context:
@samsung978531 New S21 ATT variant purchased from Samsung.com 1/27/21, activated on ATT network 2/3/21. ATT unlock database does not recognize IMEI as an ATT device. ATT claims data received from Samsung omitted this device. Samsung claims that unlock codes were provided at time of manufacturer and the issue is with ATT. While I was on the phone with advanced ATT support, they called Samsung support to request an unlock code per CTIA guidance. That request was denied. 

In researching this issue online, it appears to be a common problem with carrier locked devices sold by Samsung.com. I have spoken now to 9 support people at ATT over 3 days. They physically cannot unlock this device without data sharing from Samsung. Meanwhile, Samsung CS pins the blame on ATT. I purchased this device at retail and it is under warranty. ATT agrees that it is eligible for unlock and are willing to unlock the device but cannot without updated data from Samsung. As a customer, I have been caught in the middle. I have sent details via Twitter messenger to Samsung Mobile US with no reply. I have spent hours on the phone with Samsung CS without being offered any solution, only finger pointing. I have provided enough detail for Samsung engineering to work with ATT to provide data necessary for a carrier unlock code for this device. 

If I RMA the device back to Samsung, I will be out a phone and will be forced to waste half a day to set up a new device with no guarantee that it won't have the same issue. There is clearly a communication problem and/or inconsistent policy between Samsung and ATT. I have also read similar accounts with other carriers. IMO, there should be an option to purchase a carrier variant which is unlocked from the factory. There is zero reason for these devices to be locked since they are purchased at retail and not subject to ATT payment plan or other ATT subsidized pricing dependent on service contracts. The unbranded US factory unlocked variant of this device likely does not support ATT features such as HD Voice, Call Protect, wifi calling, etc. 

Simply because the IMEI of this device appears in the Samsung internal database does not mean that it appears in ATT's unlock code database. I see this as a database management and data sharing glitch that potentially impacts thousands of customers. Most will not realize that they have purchased a device incapable of unlock until their Samsung warranty has expired.

Please do not suggest that I contact ATT customer support which I have exhausted in spades. I am asking Samsung to contact ATT and provide a joint solution. This should happen seamlessly without involving the customer. I feel like I have been dragged into a bad marriage.

1636.title: Please bring back Iris Scanner
1636.context:
Please bring back iris scanning.
Iris unlocking is faster than facial recognition, more secure, works in the dark, regardless of wearing a mask, and usually regardless of wearing glasses.

Facial recognition does not work in the dark, or if wearing a mask, 
Fingerprint recognition does not work with dry skin or gloves.

Dropping iris scanning is like getting a new 70" smart TV in 2021 that only supports 1080p. If people weren't using it, it's because they didn't know about it.

1712.title: Copying a calendar item
1712.context: I finally figured this out. Open the existing Calendar item you want to copy. In the lower left corner of your screen, choose the Copy icon. The existing Calendar item changes into an edit state. Modify the date in the existing Calendar item and save it. All done! Your existing Calendar item remains unchanged and you now have a copy of the existing item on the new date that you saved! Note that I tried this on a Galaxy S21+ G5, but I think it works on all recent Galaxy models.

1743.title: Systemwide Chatheads
1743.context:
I just wanted to suggest feedback for the chatheads if at all possible. Right now they're almost perfect to me. The main thing here is comparing it to Facebook Messenger; while if I'm having a prolonged conversation, I'll keep the chathead up. However, often times I'm just replying quickly and will dismiss it immediately. 

The problem here is that Messenger remembers where the chathead was before dismissal and will default to that location when the chathead comes back up after being dismissed. Unfortunately, One UI 3.1's chathead function will always come up on the left of the screen, which is difficult for a righty like myself.

My only other gripe is that I really LOVE the pop up conversation here. It's great to be able to reply, see previous messages and go over the previous character limit without needing to open the app entirely. I just wish we had that functionality without chatheads. Seeing somthing similar to iOS would be ideal; a quick reply through a button via the notification banner that brings up the same interphase introduced with these systemwide chatheads.

1748.title: S21/S21Plus/S21Ultra Shipping Tracking Thread (STT)!
1748.context:
Hi everyone,
 Have you preordered a new phone? Share with us! It helps to keep track together, to get an idea on when they ship, what models are being delivered sooner and in general, help each other deal with the long wait for a new phone!
 Which model, storage size, color did you order? 
Carrier variant or unlocked?
Are you trading in your current device?
What did you order with your pre-order bonus? 
 And finally, what do you like the most about these new phone? What made you want to order it right away? Or are you still thinking about it? Do you have any concerns?
 I was thinking about it for few days, but finally placed an order today!
 S21 Ultra (The camera, screen and battery life are the most exciting features to me)
128GB (I know, never enough, but I looked at my current usage and since pictures and videos are backed up to Google Photos, it should actually be plenty. 256GB for only $50 more was tempting, but it wasn't available in the color I want and the other color ships 3 weeks later too!)
Phantom Silver (Just like silver or white phones)
AT&T (Usually get my carrier model to take advantage of advanced network features)
Trading in Note 20 Ultra (Yes, it's a tough call since the Note is an amazing device, but their pre-order offers are too good! Couldn't resist)
Used my Pre-Order Bonus to get a Galaxy Watch Active2, a Leather case and a Rugged case. The new Buds Pro were tempting, but I already have 4 pairs of Samsung earbuds (Buds, Buds+, Live, IconX) so I figured a new smartwatch will be more useful! 


If my post answered your question, please be sure to accept it as solution so other users can find answers quicker. And give it a Like. Thanks

1785.title: Questions about the S21 line and OneUI Questions/Feature Requests.
1785.context:
While I doubt this will get any traction, I would like to ask multiple questions about the S21 line and OneUI while making feature requests. I would put the OneUI section in a OneUI section of the forum but it doesn't exist. If you agree with my thoughts and/or want one of the things that I mentioned to be changed too, please reply with +1 to the point(s) I make.
  --Model Colors--
The S21 line is beautiful and they look great but I'd like to know why Pink, Violet*1, Grey and White are limited to base S21; Violet, Silver*2, Black*3 to S21+ and all of the Samsung Store exclusives (Gold and Red for S21+ and Titanium, Navy and Brown for S21U, I'm also not saying make these not store exclusives) are limited to their specific models. Each model should be able to get the same colors and be colorful.
  --Heart rate and SP02 sensor removal--
Obviously this is for money but why did the heartrate and co sensors got removed from the S21 Line and S20 line, these are incrediblely useful sensors to have on a smartphone.
  --MicroSD Slot--
Why has the MicroSD card slot been removed from the S21 line? You gave us 8K @24 FPS which eats up massive amounts of storage, "8K Video Snap" which takes 33MP pictures from the 8K frames and upgraded Single Take which also results in a lot of storage usage. The storage options you provide are large but not big enough for this. On the official samsung website*4, it is stated that 1 minute of 8K24 video produces a file of 600MB, per 5 minute videos this equals 3GB video files. A 128GB device gives 110GB *5 usable space which results in 36.3r Hours of 8K24 Video (r standing for recurring), this doesn't take into account any other storage usage from apps or files which makes the 36 Hour quickly shrink. Assuming that 18GB is given to the System across each model, a 512GB model gives you 164.66r Hours of 8K24 not taking into account other files or apps. 164.66 sounds like a lot until you spread it over 24 hour days and it becomes only 6.86 days. There are many users who take video very regularly and will burn through this local storage. I'll continue with this in my next point. There are also users who modify their devices who require persistant local storage for important files such as photos, music or movies for when they are reinstalling or moving to a custom build of Android. This hurts that community. Having a MicroSD card slot also provides the safety for said important files incase of a unforseeable problem occurs such as a major issue or bug in the OneUI build which results in the device or internal storage being rendered inaccessible which might need the internal storage formatted to fix the issue.
  --Online storage push/soft requirement--
I understand why online storage is getting pushed as an alternative to the MicroSD card slot but there are many negatives to this solution. The main one being users in countries where you can't get much Mobile data to use because it isn't avaliable or that it is too expensive. Users might not be able to get broadband due to it being expensive, the avaliablity in the area or that they aren't allowed to get broadband for other reasons. By the looks of things, you can't pick your provider so you are forced to go with Microsoft's OneDrive if you can completely disable this intergration, great. I'm also assuming that the provider can't be changed to another provider who provides cloud services over a common standard which obviously makes issues when a user already has a pre-existing cloud solution or if they don't like Microsoft because of privacy or for other reasons.
  --Allow the user to change maximum clock speed--
This one will be the most "yeah this isn't going to be addressed" topic within this but I'm still going to say it. These should be put in Developer Options or something similar. I don't understand why there isn't a stock samsung solution to change the clock speed of the CPU/GPU, while this is very niche, there should be a way for users to change their maximum clock speed to a lower value than the pre-existing limit for saving much more battery. I saw a recent video*6 from MrWhoseTheBoss (no affiliation or connection in anyway other than I watch his content) where he did a battery test with the S21U (Exynos) vs 2 other Samsung phones and 2 iPhones and the S21U achieved 8 Hours and 41 Minutes which is impressive but this is a brand new phone which if used for a few years won't achieve the same SoT but if a user could lower their maximum clock speed, they'd be able to get more SoT out of their battery today and in years time. It would be nice to be able to change this on a per app basis. Users shouldn't have to root for this.
  --Move the Sensors Off quick settings tile--
With the latest Android 11 aiming to put a bit more power into the consumers when it comes to consumer privacy and moving the Sensors Off quick setting tile from the Developer Options menu (About Phone > Software Information > Tap build number 7 times > Main Menu > Developer Options > Quick settings developer tiles > Sensors Off) to the Quick Settings menu would help to give more privacy back to the user. The Sensors Off tile for those who don't know, once enabled, stops the Camera, Microphone and all sensors from working until disabled. 2G phone calls aren't affected for some reason. Once disabled, the camera, microphone and sensors work like normal. There should be a box you have to tick in order to use it such as "When you use this, the following features will be disabled until this tile is turned off" so the user isn't stuck in wondering why these isn't working.
  --Move non Samsung apps away from /system/app // /system/priv-app--
This one speaks for itself. Why is Facebook, Facebook App Manager, Facebook Services, Chrome, Duo, Gmail, Onedrive, Google installed in those directories, especially Facebook's apps?
Please give the option for users to uninstall Bixby, Dex and other Windows intergrations and other apps which aren't required for OneUI to function or stay stable. Example being the AR apps, Knox apps, the ones listed above, YouTube and other google apps (not including Play Store/Services).
  --Give the user the ability to modify hosts--
This one also explains itself. The user should be able to modify the hosts file for the purposes of blocking ads and malware domains.
  --Doze improvements--
It would be nice to have an option for Doze to be enabled after 5 minutes of the screen being off rather than hours that it takes while the phone has to be motionless. It would be nice that within this mode, motion detection is also turned off to save more power.
  --Uninstaller improvements--
Please make the uninstaller remove all residual files and directories assuming they weren't saved by the user.
  --Statusbar additions--
Please add an icon to the statusbar so users can see the total network activity.
Please add an option for seconds to be added to the clock.
  *1 = Violet is on the S21 and S21+.
*2 = Silver is on S21+ and S21U.
*3 = Silver is on S21+ and S21U
*4 = https://www.samsung.com/uk/support/mobile-devices/meet-the-unprecedented-8k-video-with-galaxy-s20-pl...
*5 = Number from a 128GB S10+ on OneUI 3, It was 109.93GB total avaliable.

1813.title: Poor WiFi Range
1813.context:
My s21 ultra (snapdragon, unlocked) wifi range is really poor. Mobile data works perfectly, but on wifi I have to be right next to the router to get anything over 2 mbps consistently. 

Here's what I've tried: 
Reset network settings
Boot into safe mode (issue persists in safe mode)
Factory reset phone and opted out of smart switch after reset
Turned off 5g
Tried with/without bluetooth
Turned off Google Location Accuracy Restarted router
Changed router frequency channel
Reset router to default ssttings
Changed MAC address to phone MAC

I do not see any messages like "Connected Without Internet". The connection just says "Connected". Very occasionally some apps will cause a message along the lines of "WiFi unstable, waiting for stable wifi before continuing"

Every other device in the home connects just fine, including my previous phone s7 edge. On my s7 edge, I can be on the complete other side of the house and still get reasonable speeds. 

When enabling mobile data tethering on another device, I can connect to that device's hotspot with a reasonable speed.

When checking the speed directly next to the router, I see good speeds, as expected with any device right next to a router. A couple feet or more away from the router, and the speeds are abyssmal as described. It seems the WiFi range on my device has huge exponential drop-off after a couple feet.

My router is single-band (2.4GHz only). The model is MI424WR rev 1.0. I pay for 100 mbps, my s7 edge gets around 25 mbps consistently, but the s21 ultra gets around 1mbps on average, and very commonly even less than that.

Due to COVID I will likely not be able to test my device on anyone else's router but my own anytime soon.

Is it safe to say the device is defective? Do you recommend I RMA this device? Anyone else with similar issues have advice? Sure one can argue I have an "older" router but I would expect this device to at least match the network performance of my S7 edge. It does not make sense to me to say this is an issue with the router.

I have submitted an error report through Samsung Members, just thought I'd post here as well to get more community feedback and discussion going.

1831.title: Suggestion/Request for LTE only
1831.context: I'd like to request the the S21 line have an LTE only option. Where I am, there is just barely an almost non existent 5G signal. When the phone detects it, it automatically switches to 5G, with no option to stay on LTE. 1903.title: S21 Ultra 8k Camera
1903.context:
This is what I know about 8k video recording. I use it frequently on my n20u. For 1 just a 1minute video uses about 1gigabyte of memory. Thats huge amount of data for 1minute of service. Next thing about he 8k recording is it will only load to internal memory while recording. That tripped me out when I was looking for the best memory card I could find. Fone stills records to internal memory. You can only record 4k 30and below if I remember correctly, directly to sdcard. 

Next my n20u gets real warm with 8k video recording for extended periods. 

Heat kills proessors and batteries. So anything that produces heat above ambient temperatures that you the human can feel in fingertips is not good for any sensitive electrical equipment. All you need is a thousandth of a millimeter gap and it breaks a circuit.
